line_1: While the slow Pulse with equal Motion beats,
line_2: And when his Skill perceives the slaking Heats,

line_1: Rooted we stand, the Heart incessant beats,
line_2: And hasty Strokes the quicker Pulse repeats.

line_1: With sounding Hoof the heathy Common beats,
line_2: While far behind the hollowing Peasant sweats.
While his vague mind's in quest of sweets,

line_1: Your Heart an equal Measure beats:
line_2: Alike unfelt its Pains or Sweets,

line_1: Round their firm Sides in vain the Tempest beats;
line_2: And still the foaming Wave with lessen'd Pow'r retreats.

line_1: My heart, as for a passage, loudly beats,
line_2: And, turn me where I will, distraction meets.

line_1: And round the grass-grown dewy border beats,
line_2: Giles with a pole assails their close retreats,

line_1: Flutters now low, and then in thunder beats;
line_2: Or as the drum a certain sound repeats,

line_1: Yet, when no more the pulse tumultuous beats,
line_2: Nor the pleas'd sense each flattering tale repeats,

line_1: To him alone th' expanding bosom beats;
line_2: For he alone all human bliss compleats,
